name: NPR
text:
New Supreme Court Justice Amy Coney Barrett heard her first oral arguments at the Supreme Court Monday.  

The court said that she did not participate in the court's work last week after being sworn in so she would be prepared for oral arguments this week. https://t.co/Edu6mp5QKH

name: NPR
text:
Only 3 gubernatorial races are considered competitive this year.

In Missouri and North Carolina, the contests may tell us if the pandemic has the power to make or break a governor. But in Montana, politics have complicated the issue.
https://t.co/8J5tnlefne

name: NPR
text:
A Nevada judge has rejected a lawsuit by President Trump's reelection campaign and state Republican officials that sought to halt mail-in ballot counting in the state's most populous county.
https://t.co/UtXJnfrF5j

name: NPR
text:
A Dutch train burst past the end of its elevated tracks in the Netherlands on Monday.

But instead of crashing to the ground 30 feet below, the metro train was caught — held aloft by an artist's massive sculpture of a whale's tail. https://t.co/XW7AzFFBn4

name: NPR
text: Among those anxiously watching the U.S. presidential election is a Guatemalan mother and her teenaged son who have taken refuge in a church in Austin, Texas, for the entirety of Donald Trump's presidency. https://t.co/dNFelNPLHs

name: NPR
text:
House Speaker Nancy Pelosi tells NPR that she’s ready for the House of Representatives to decide the winner of the presidential election — if it comes to that.
https://t.co/Wu7TGOBMf8

name: NPR
text: Republican Sen. Kelly Loeffler is campaigning on being “more conservative than Attila the Hun," to keep her Georgia seat. But this is no party primary. It's an open election with 20 candidates. https://t.co/kfCfKUiL7i

name: NPR
text:
The prime minister of New Zealand, Jacinda Ardern, has appointed Nanaia Mahuta as minister of foreign affairs — making her the nation's first Indigenous woman to hold the position.
https://t.co/jFEmD6UNnv

name: NPR
text: A lot of airlines are hurting for customers during the pandemic. But now, a new policy from the largest airline in the U.S. is preventing some people who use power wheelchairs from traveling at all. https://t.co/08BqzEY0OF

name: NPR
text:
In "The Upswing," Robert Putnam and Shaylyn Romney Garrett argue that history — particularly America's Gilded Age — could hold the answers for how to move out of today's tumultuous age.
 https://t.co/ekyFBdieS4

name: NPR
text:
A generation of Puerto Ricans who have seen the island struggle with its years-long recession is about to head to the polls in Tuesday's elections.

And the two main political parties in the U.S. territory may see their dominance begin to slip. https://t.co/MYQTQx5feB

name: NPR
text:
A federal judge has rejected a Trump administration rule that would have denied green cards to immigrants accessing food stamps and other public benefits.
https://t.co/9fF0aHJBM1

name: NPR
text: Pennsylvania Secretary of State Kathy Boockvar reminded reporters Monday that, most years, it takes more than a week for the state to count all ballots — and this is not a normal year. It's effort to stop candidates from prematurely claiming victory. @WITF https://t.co/z55EitAmio

name: NPR
text:
Over the weekend, more than 3.6 million Slovaks were tested for the coronavirus — amid a steep spike in cases. The prime minister hopes the effort can ward off a more severe lockdown.
https://t.co/4ibrC0zES9

name: NPR
text:
Four ways to help cope with election stress:

1️⃣ prepare mentally for delayed results
2️⃣ double down on stress-reducing habits
3️⃣ replace scrolling with something nourishing
4️⃣ look for signs of hope
https://t.co/KurgLtLzXn

name: NPR
text:
People who live on reservations often have a harder time voting due to bad roads, long distances and lack of formal addresses, among other factors.

This year, the coronavirus pandemic is adding even more challenges.
https://t.co/OlmQTfyOFV

name: NPR
text: Aaron “Jay” Danielson and Michael Reinoehl shared common backgrounds but polar opposite views, sharpened by the protests in Portland, Ore. There, they'd each finally discovered a sense of greater purpose. But their encounter led to their deaths. @OPB https://t.co/KivxRdv7Sd

text:

name: NPR
text:
RAIN is an acronym for a four-step mindfulness tool:

1) recognize — sense whatever feeling is predominant in this moment
2) allow — let yourself be with that feeling
3) investigate — ask yourself what you need
4) nurture — offer yourself what is needed
https://t.co/gSE5D34XxL

name: NPR

text:

name: NPR
text:
Aside from a Fox and Friends interview and a trip to RNC offices in Arlington, Va, President Trump has no other travel plans today.

Meanwhile, Joe Biden is in Pennsylvania. He and Kamala Harris are set to speak in Wilmington, Del., this evening. https://t.co/71nUOUwThI

name: NPR
text:

text:

text: As of Election Day morning, 100,298,938 Americans had voted early this year. https://t.co/WKfnOkmXil
